text: One more question for you if you don't mind! Does a "call" directly translate to a row in a table? So 10 rows can only be called at one time and use the "Limit" and "Offset" parameters to limit the number of results that populate at one time on a page? Why on this page then, with 31 rows/results shown at one time, am I only 4 over the allowed 10 per page (according to the source code)? <https://www.alignex.com/upcoming-training>
Can HubDB have a File field? where a user can upload a file? like a Word docx?
that message is little misleading. actualy there were 14 calls and 4 were over the limit of 10.
One "call" is one instance of the hubdb_table_rows function running. It doesn't matter how many rows you pull.
If you don't have the function a bunch of times in your template, you're probably using it in a loop somewhere
We do not have at this time.
